definition: To emphasize or stress a particular aspect or point in speech or writing, often by giving it more prominence or importance. It is commonly used when discussing communication techniques or public speaking skills.

examples.german: Ich möchte betonen, dass ich damit nichts zu tun habe.
examples.english: I want to emphasize that I have nothing to do with it.

examples.german: Er betonte die Wichtigkeit einer guten Ausbildung.
examples.english: He stressed the importance of a good education.

examples.german: Sie betonte ihre Unabhängigkeit und Selbstständigkeit.
examples.english: She emphasized her independence and self-reliance.

examples.german: Der Redner betonte immer wieder seine Hauptargumente.
examples.english: The speaker repeatedly emphasized his main arguments.

examples.german: Die Lehrerin betonte die richtige Aussprache der Wörter.
examples.english: The teacher emphasized the correct pronunciation of the words.
